meanings.definition: To be filled with wonder or astonishment.
meanings.sent1: The children were marvelling at the colorful fireworks in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help marvelling at the beautiful sunset over the ocean.
meanings.sent3: As the magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, the audience sat marvelling at the unexpected trick.
meanings.sent4: The explorer found himself marvelling at the vastness of the untouched jungle before him.
meanings.sent5: The little girl stood marvelling at the intricate details of the snowflake on her mitten.

meanings.sent1: The art enthusiasts were marvelling at the skillful brushstrokes of the painting.
meanings.sent2: He spent hours marvelling at the craftsmanship of the antique clock he inherited.
meanings.sent3: The chef couldn't help marvelling at the delicious aroma coming from the kitchen next door.
meanings.sent4: She found herself marvelling at the dedication of the volunteers cleaning up the park.
meanings.sent5: The musician stood marvelling at the talent of the young violinist performing on stage.
